availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathaniel H. Ryan (Calloway County, KY, sheriff)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, sheriff. Virginia native. Married to Sally Ann Ryan. Father of C.C.K. Ryan, N.A. Ryan, Mary E. Ryan, Edmond H. Ryan, Nancy P. Ryan, Thankful N. Ryan, and Phillip N. Ryan. Farmer in Calloway County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Sheriff in Calloway County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 485A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 862.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 193.
"Nathaniel Hill Ryan (1806-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial 24922596, accessed May 15, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/24922596.
